intro: Dendrobium vanuatuense, commonly known as the Vanuatu orchid, is an epiphytic orchid native to the islands of Vanuatu. It features a sympodial growth habit with erect, cylindrical pseudobulbs that store water and nutrients. The plant produces clusters of fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers during the wet season. Its leaves are革质 (leathery) and arranged in a spiral pattern around the stem. Dendrobium vanuatuense is adapted to grow in humid, shaded environments with good air circulation.
